alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Marlboro (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 1:50PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Florence, western Dillon, Darlington and Marlboro Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 150 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Florence Darlington Technical College Main Campus, or near Darlington, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Florence, Bennettsville, Hartsville, Darlington, Timmonsville, Mccoll, Lamar, Quinby, Clio, Mont Clare, Mars Bluff, Brownsville, Lydia, Darlington Raceway, Swift Creek, Florence Darlington Technical College Main Campus, Oats, Chavistown, Floyd and New Hope. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between mile markers 126 and 141. Interstate 95 in South Carolina near mile marker 146, and between mile markers 152 and 187. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
